value.title: LivePerson acquires VoiceBase and Tenfold for its conversational AI platform
value.excerpt: LivePerson has acquired two startups, VoiceBase and Tenfold, to bolster its expanding conversational AI platform.

value.title: Intel partners with Google to deploy ‘Mount Evans’ ASIC-based GPU
value.excerpt: Intel has announced that it partnered with Google to deploy the chipmaker's IPU across Google Cloud infrastructure.

value.title: Abacus.ai snags $50M Series C as it expands into computer vision use cases
value.excerpt: Abacus.ai wants to build an AI platform that simplifies machine learning model creation, while still leaving room for power users. Today the company announced a $50 million Series C. At the same time,

value.title: Intel Challenges AMD And NVIDIA With New AI Technologies Amid Renewed Developer Commitments
value.excerpt: Intel renews AI Technologies with Sapphire Rapids CPU and Ponte Vecchio GPUs. But can they do better than AMD and NVIDIA?

value.title: Self-driving company Cruise on track for early commercial operations in 2022
value.excerpt: General Motors CEO Mary Barra is “pretty confident” that the driver will be out of Cruise vehicles by 2022, as the company looks to enter early commercial operations for autonomous robotaxi and delivery services.

value.title: Could facial recognition be the future of airport security? Delta Air Lines is testing it out
value.excerpt: Delta Air Lines is testing new facial recognition technology to reduce the time it takes between arriving at the airport and getting passengers in their seats.

value.title: Robot taxi boats take to the water in Amsterdam
value.excerpt: The self-driving boat, dubbed Roboat III, is the creation of MIT's Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL), the Senseable City Laboratory, and the Amsterdam Institute for Advanced Metropolitan Solutions.

value.title: Unpacking AI And Key Drivers For Modern Business Environments
value.excerpt: C-level business leaders such as chief information officers, chief technology officers and chief financial officers must strive to understand that. How quickly the adoption, efficiency and efficacy of these technologies work depends on the approach and blueprint that are developed.

value.title: Adobe’s Project Strike a Pose uses AI to pose your models for you
value.excerpt: One of the highlights of Adobe’s annual MAX conference is its so-called ‘Sneaks’ session, where the company shows off some of its most cutting-edge research projects. Some of these make it into the mainline Creative Cloud apps and some simply remain cool demos.

value.title: This Automotive Company Revs Up Machine Learning To Turbocharge Engine Quality
value.excerpt: With help from SAP, Mumbai-based MHEL replaced its outmoded physical engine testing with virtual testing – using artificial intelligence and machine learning while incorporating data from a variety of sources.

value.title: First Look: Delta, TSA Launch Facial Recognition At Atlanta Airport
value.excerpt: The next step in airport automation has become a reality, just in time for the holidays. Delta Airlines, the Transportation Security Administration (TSA), and a travel tech company called Pangiam have partnered up to bring facial recognition technology to the Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL).

value.title: How Humans-In-The-Loop AI Can Help Solve The Data Problem
value.excerpt: Humans-in-the-loop AI is a niche wherein AI and ML systems are built with human interference at different stages of the cycle, whenever it’s necessary.

value.title: Top Indian Robotics Start-ups that have Gained Funding in 2021
value.excerpt: India has been evolving as the biggest start-ups ecosystem. In which robotics start-ups have a great visible space. Let’s know more about the Indian robotics start-ups funding in 2021 in this article.

value.title: Dubai to soon have regulation to pave way for driverless cars on roads
value.excerpt: Dubai: Dubai expects in 2022 to complete the regulation needed to allow self-driving cars on the roads by 2023, a senior official said on Wednesday. Ahmed Hashim Bahrozyan, CEO of the Public Transport Agency of Dubai’s Roads and Transport Authority (RTA) told reporters: “We are quite fast compared to other cities in issuing the regulation [to govern self-driving cars on the roads].

value.title: Google Tensor gets crushed by Apple A15 in machine learning despite being a ML-centric chip
value.excerpt: The Google Tensor processor is supposed be all about machine learning but it got crushed by the Apple A15 Bionic in the Geekbench ML app.

value.title: Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud results soar as the world goes digital
value.excerpt: Microsoft Cloud generated $20.7 billion in revenue for Q3 2021, which is an year on year increase of 36%, driven by a 50% growth in Azure and other cloud services revenue. Similarly, Google Cloud revenues neared $5 billion thanks to a 45% jump,

value.title: One Drop Delivers Novel AI-Powered Solution For Cardiovascular Disease Prevention
value.excerpt: One Drop, a leader in precision health solutions for people living with chronic conditions worldwide, today announced the release of a digital, AI-enabled cardiovascular disease (CVD) prevention module.

value.title: Computer vision platform Cogniac nabs $20M to bolster its customer acquisition efforts
value.excerpt: Cogniac, a startup developing computer vision technology primarily for industrial and manufacturing companies, raised $20 million in capital.

value.title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 3070 vs. AMD Radeon RX 6800: Which GPU should you buy?
value.excerpt: We compare Nvidia's GeForce RTX 3070 and AMD's Radeon RX 6800 across a wide range of metrics. Performance matters—but the price may matter even more.

value.title: Microsoft powers transformation at NVIDIA GTC Fall—GPU technology conference
value.excerpt: This year during NVIDIA GTC 21, we’re spotlighting some of the most transformational applications powered by NVIDIA accelerated computing that highlights our commitment to edge, on-premises, and cloud computing. Registration is free, so sign up to learn how Microsoft is powering transformation.

value.title: Report: 81% of online retailers increase AI budget to boost holiday sales
value.excerpt: AI is becoming an essential tool in ecommerce, used to enable targeted campaigns and improve supply chain management.

value.title: Nightly News Full Broadcast (October 26th)
value.excerpt: FDA panel recommends Pfizer’s Covid vaccine for kids ages 5 to 11, powerful nor’easter hits East Coast, and how facial recognition will change the way you travel.

value.title: Train models faster with an automated data profiler for Amazon Fraud Detector
value.excerpt: Amazon Fraud Detector is a fully managed service that makes it easy to identify potentially fraudulent online activities, such as the creation of fake accounts or online payment fraud. Amazon Fraud Detector uses machine learning (ML) under the hood and is based on over 20 years of fraud detection expertise

value.title: Machine learning reveals brain networks involved in child aggression
value.excerpt: Child psychiatric disorders, such as oppositional defiant disorder and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), can feature outbursts of anger and physical aggression. A better understanding of what drives these symptoms could help inform treatment strategies.
